source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers in lax leafy panicles; corolla yellow often striped with red or purple; pod oblong, 10–25 mm long; probably not in Victoria, see note after genus description
Flowers in leafy racemes; corolla pink or purple; pod ovate, 5–10 mm long
Stems usually procumbent, often rooting at nodes, unarmed or with soft spines; leaflets obtuse or emarginate
Stems usually erect or ascending, not rooting at nodes, armed with rigid spines; leaflets acute or obtuse
